text:
Hello everyone!

I'm looking at the data we get on the website and I see `"local_time_zone": "Europe/London"`  although I am in Spain. Why is this the case and how can I get the local time zone of a user visiting our website?

I want this info to be able to display the events time in local time zone of the user.

Thanks
Hey all, i have a blog listing page with different design for each blog post. is it possible to use some condition to catch the post by id and use different html for every post? any ideas?
how can i get the post id?
You can also stylise different design based on `nth-child` css. hope this will help.
the issue i have is that the whole HTML structure is different... can i change structure with nth-child??
Nop, you can’t change html structure…but why html structure is different ?? :thinking_face:
You’re in full control of the HTML so you can do pretty much anything you want - I wouldn’t hardcode logic for ID’s though.
However, if the structure is different - maybe use a combination of <@UNWHHSWHJ>’s suggestion and css grid? This may allow you to get around having different markup
Otherwise I imagine you’re trying to squeeze something into blogs which would be best suited in HubDB

hmm what if i have a field like style param in HubDB and when the client is making the post they select design style. then from the template i just do simple if statement to show content based on the selected style in hubDB. but then i have no idea if that is possible to combide stuff from hubDB and blogs
hmm so the actual question is, can i combine data in the blog post with data from HubDB??
are <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/speed/lazy-loading|lazy loading >options available for the *logo module field*?
I don't ever use it .
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/tags#logo>
Yes the attribute is `loading`

Could you use the get content by IDs function?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions#content-by-ids>

get the content of all the posts on the listing page and have a custom module on the blog post to select the parameters, it might work
I could but then the posts will be hardcoded... and if the client deletes the post. It will break the page
If i can add a custom property to the blog post like custom_field and then if the field is selected, show particular html view
Does that makes sense? Is this even possible?
Where is the developer info from a website coming from? is there a way to make changes to it?
As far as the logo module field goes it isn't available there yet but something we are looking into.
I’m not sure about custom properties.
if you only have a few posts per page you can just do if loop.index == postnumber to make it easier to read
Postnumber is postID or the actual post number?
or do you want a particular post to keep it's style so post with id #123 always looks like this, post with id #321 always looks like that?
ah ok thanks y’all
